p.seg: Ji Kangzi asked Kongzi:
“Since I obtained the government,
I do not know at all about how to stabilize the service of the people.
This is (therefore) (my) giving worries to you [I am therefore bothering you with my questions].
May I ask
about the way of the gentleman in attending affairs,
[...] towards the people [...]
Kongzi said:
“treating them humanely by means of virtue,
this is the great service of the gentleman.”
Kangzi said:
“may I ask what does it mean to treat them humanely by means of virtue?”
Kongzi said:
“When the gentleman is above the people,
and holds the center of the people,
administering education to the hundred clans,
and yet the people do not submit,
this is the shame of the gentleman.
Therefore the gentleman makes his words like jade
and makes his actions accomplished,
respectfully develops his virtue to approach the people,
the people look at his method and submit,
this is what it means to treat them humanely by means of virtue.
Moreover Guanzhong has a saying:
“When the gentleman is humble he succeeds,
when he is proud he is humiliated,
accomplished words are very difficult [...]
Kangzi said:
“Can it be that what I have heard
is wrong?
Certainly it is like you are helping me.
Kongzi declined and said:
“your words have their weight.
I have heard that the gentleman [...]
[Kangzi said:]
I would rather change myself.
Kongzi said:
I have heard
Meng Zi Yu saying:
“Books
are to record the virtue of the gentleman,
odes
are to record the intent of the gentleman,
rituals
are to make sincere the acts of the gentleman.
The gentleman extends it,
the petty person observes it,
the gentleman respectfully accomplishes his virtue,
the petty person is befuddled.
If in all cases when they face a crisis they get orders
and force them upon the people,
then the state will have treasonous actions.
The one hundred surnames send them out to [...]
Extinction will come fast and they will not last!
The latter generations will approach disaster,
the states will mutually harbor destruction,
the multitude will necessarily dislike what is good.
Worthy people [...]
[...] Deep and thick.
Therefore (even if) oppressing the state is very difficult,
the people can be easily changed (for the better) [...]
If the fields are fertile,
the people are at peace.
If they are barren,
the people will not cultivate.
Therefore the worthies are considered great in the state,
and have a great heart,
and can be feared [...]
follow the old regulations and rites
and promulgate them,
do not go against the one hundred activities,
in all cases ask to enact them [...]
[...] quiet there.
If one rises and controls them,
then the state has an advantage.
What the ancestors considered good,
one should also consider it good.
What the ancestors did [...]
one should not do;
what the ancestors rejected,
one should not initiate.
Then the people will reject what is not good,
and there will not be the case of fathers, elder brothers, sons and younger brothers being called enemy.
[...] there will be no difficulties.
One should not forget his female relatives
but treat them respectfully yet at a distance,
and then the people will have ritual propriety,
and thereafter one will give them the permanent middle.
[...] entangled (?).
Lie Jin told me
about the technique to deal with the state and the main families:
“The gentleman cannot but be strong,
if he is not strong he will not establish himself.
[...] [The gentlemancannot but be] majestic,
if he is not majestic then the people will (?) him.
[...] not trusting ???
if he does not trust ???
he will avail himself of those who are deemed worthy in the country
and employ them as officials.
One who commits a great sin, kill him,
one who commits a common sin, punish him,
one who commits a small sin, fine him.
If you can observe
and enact strictly these (rules),
the people will be necessarily compliant.
Now what do you think about these words?
Confucius answered:
“As I see it,
they are seductive words.
But now, Lie Jin’s ancestors
were scribes of the three dynasties,
how does he dare to talk not using his ancestors’ intent?
And Kangzi said:
“But he exhorts others saying:
“In antiquity those who governed states all used these (principles)”
Confucius answered:
“As words they are really seductive.
But they are different from what I have heard.
I heard this.
Zang Wenzhong once said:
If the gentleman is strong he is abandoned,
if he is stern the people do not follow him,
if he is harsh then he loses the masses,
if he is fierce then he has no intimate,
if he likes punishments it is inauspicious,
if he likes killing he produces chaos.
Therefore the way the worthies deal with the state and families,
they wake up early and go to sleep late,
they lower the extremes to make them close (?),
they exhort the people to (do) beautiful things,
they reject ugly things and let them not return,
they are careful about small things in order to achieve great harmony,
they talk without severity but observe strictly what they say.
They are not solemn or distant,
they neither cause people to come or to leave,
they do not set traps for bad people,
they do not treat good people as precious,
they save people with intimacy,
those who commit great crimes are treated with punishment,
those who commit normal crimes are treated with fines,
those who commit small crimes are pardoned.
